snippet: The decision for the tests, which will begin next week, came on the heels of a ruling by the Food and Drug Administration to deny renaming high-fructose corn syrup to corn sugar.
abstract: Agriculture Department says it will expand testing for E. coli in raw beef trimmings; ruling appears to side with consumers, and comes on the heels of a Food and Drug Administration decision to deny renaming high-fructose corn syrup to corn sugar; Consumers Union applauds both decisions.
lead_paragraph: The decision for the tests, which will begin next week, came on the heels of a ruling by the Food and Drug Administration to deny renaming high-fructose corn syrup to corn sugar.

headline.seo: Agriculture Department Calls for More Beef Testing
headline.main: Government to Increase E. Coli Tests in Raw Beef
headline.print_headline: Government To Increase E. Coli Tests In Raw Beef
